text: I bought this for my mother. She doesn’t need all the extras so I saw the price on this and definitely went for it! She’s in her 70s and needs it for getting on the Internet and Facebook and keeping in touch with her friends and of course, her pictures and videos. It has more than enough and I mean more than enough storage for what she needs it for. why spend all that money for all that storage when you don’t need it? So happy with my purchase! And she is so thrilled because hers was only holding a charge for a couple of hours and now she’s got this one and she’s back on Facebook, and happier than ever!
title: Excellent purchase
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023

text: In the product summary there are clearly pictures of the Apple Pen and Apple keyboard.  Under "About this item", it includes a detailed description of the Apple pen and keyboard.  Then at the very end of that paragraph include a statement "accessories not included".  Why describe it in "about this item" if they are not included?  Why not add a case, a screen protector, and a backup battery in there and say "not included"?  It's a little odd...and a little misleading I think.  I looked up other iPads for sale and none of them included a description of accessories under "about this item" because they were not included.That is my only criticism of the posting of the item.  Other than that, it was a good value for the money, scratch and dent free, and seemed to be operating perfectly.  It arrived fast (same day) which is good because I needed it quickly for a work project.
title: Good value for the money
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023

text: This Apple 🍎 iPad 9th generation is very competent and does everything I want it to do.  I don’t do anything really super complicated with it (mostly streaming 🎥 movies, surfing 🏄‍♂️ the net, and of course, ✍️ writing product reviews 🤪😁😜😛😆) so it’s fine for my needs.  Without a case, it’s just over a pound (so not that heavy).  It has fast connectivity and is intuitively, user-friendly.  The 👁️ retina display touchscreen is a pretty decent size at 10.2 inches (diagonally).  The touchscreen is sharp, vivid, true to color, and very responsive.  Also, this iPad came with a 20W USB-C power adapter, USB-C to lightning charge cable, and 3 months free Apple TV+.  The Apple TV+ is great because I have been able to watch the ⚽️ soccer/football⚽️ show, Ted Lasso, for FREE.  👍😁👍  Score!!!!!  ⚽️🥅⚽️  Apple 🍏 makes excellent, quality electronics, and this handheld computer is absolutely no exception.  👍🍏😃🍎  The only things I wish were different about this iPad are the slow charging speed and the battery drains a little faster than I would like.  I use the iPad while it’s charging and that slows down the charging speed.  I purchased this iPad for about $200 plus tax (free shipping, on sale, and had a gift card too).  I would like to buy the 10th generation iPad, but it’s just too pricey and expensive for me.  This is a much more budget-friendly option.  Long story short, I really like this iPad and am very happy with this purchase.  Because of its excellent qualities, it’s going to be very useful to me, and I think 🤔 it will last a long time.  I am impressed by it and highly recommend it (especially if money is a factor).  👍🍏🤪❤️😃🍎👍🍏😎🤔🍏👍❤️😝⭐️🩷🍎👍
title: 🍎 Excellent Quality 🍏 Value 🍎 Sharp Retina Display 🍏 User Friendly 🍎🤪🍏❤️😃😎❤️🍏
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2023

text: The Apple iPad (9th Generation) is a powerhouse device that sets a new standard for versatility, performance, and portability. Whether you're a student, a creative professional, or someone seeking a reliable and powerful tablet, this iPad is a game-changer that will revolutionize the way you work, learn, and play.The standout feature of the Apple iPad (9th Generation) is its stunning 10.2-inch Retina display. The crisp resolution and True Tone technology deliver vibrant colors and sharp details, making it a delight to watch videos, edit photos, and read e-books. The larger display provides ample space for multitasking, making it ideal for productivity tasks and creative endeavors.The iPad is powered by the A13 Bionic chip, ensuring swift and smooth performance for demanding apps and games. The processor's efficiency maximizes battery life while providing impressive processing power, allowing you to tackle any task with ease. Whether you're editing videos, running graphics-intensive apps, or engaging in augmented reality experiences, the iPad's performance remains impeccable.The iPad (9th Generation) runs on iPadOS, which provides a seamless and intuitive user experience. With features like Slide Over, Split View, and the redesigned home screen, multitasking becomes effortless, enhancing productivity and efficiency. The integration of the Apple Pencil allows for precision note-taking, sketching, and creative projects, making it a valuable tool for students and professionals alike.The iPad's versatility extends to entertainment, with access to the vast App Store and Apple Arcade. From streaming your favorite movies and TV shows to playing immersive games, the iPad delivers a rich and immersive entertainment experience. With its powerful stereo speakers, you can enjoy immersive audio without needing external accessories.The tablet's front and rear cameras capture stunning photos and videos, making it a valuable tool for content creation. Whether you're capturing memorable moments, attending virtual meetings, or recording high-quality videos, the iPad's cameras deliver impressive results.The iPad (9th Generation) supports the Smart Keyboard and Apple Pencil, transforming it into a productive workstation or a creative canvas. The Smart Connector on the iPad allows for easy attachment of the Smart Keyboard, providing a comfortable typing experience for extended writing sessions.Additionally, with the iPad's all-day battery life, you can stay productive and entertained for hours without needing to worry about recharging. The iPad's lightweight design and slim profile make it easy to carry around, making it the perfect companion for productivity on the go.In conclusion, the Apple iPad (9th Generation) is a true powerhouse that redefines versatility and performance in a tablet. With its stunning display, powerful A13 Bionic chip, iPadOS capabilities, and compatibility with the Smart Keyboard and Apple Pencil, this iPad is the ultimate tool for unleashing your creativity and productivity. Whether you're a student, a creative professional, or simply seeking an all-around capable tablet, the Apple iPad (9th Generation) is a worthwhile investment that will enhance every aspect of your digital life.
title: Unleash Your Creativity and Productivity - Apple iPad (9th Generation) Redefines Versatility
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2023

text: For over a decade, I thought anyone who spent the money on an iPad was an idiot.  I bought one Android tablet after another because they were cheap and "just as good".  But each one didn't last long before running so slow I had to replace it.  Meanwhile, my old iPhone 5 was still working great as a music and sleep machine audio device for our bedroom.  I finally decided to step up to THIS iPad back in 2021.  WHY DID I WAIT SO LONG!!!!!!  First, it is still blazingly fast and will be for basic tasks like I use it for a decade or more.  I won't have to replace this for a very very long time.  Second.....the user experience is incredible, just like an iPhone or Macbook.  I'm cheap, but wish I hadn't tried to save money buying all those garbage low end Android tablets over the years.
title: SOOOOOO much better than cheap Android tablets
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2023

text: My old Ipad Pro hasn’t worked for over a year and I also needed a new computer -  but didn’t need anything as sophisticated as a Mac so thought I would try out this 9th Gen Ipad.  So far it does most of what I would do with a larger laptop and has a touchscreen.  I was reluctant to buy Apple tech for quite a few years until I bought a small Iphone SE about 4 years ago - switched from a Samsung Galaxy..  The SE was a great size to carry around the city and it fit in most pockets and had great reception.  It was and still is a great piece of technology.  I upgraded to a 12 after 2 years and still use the SE around the house because it connects to wifi.  The 12 had a better camera and I had toddler granddaughters and after another 2 years I upgraded to the 14 PROMax which has a great camera, larger screen and is not unlike the SE except the bigger size to view photos.  I really love the touchscreen feature for NYTimes games and other interactive apps.  I worry about having most of my pictures on this technology because they could move to a more sophisticated system and make these obsolete - which is a concern. My daughter’s Iphone 13 fell in the snow a few years ago and she somehow lost all her pictures that she thought were in the cloud.  I held on to my 12 because it holds quite a bit of what she lost since we shared their photos.  Neither of us is sure why this happened and if it could happen again.  If I have a stand alone camera it isn’t convenient but I have the photos detached from the technology and the whims of a large multinational behemoth.  So far I am happy with the Ipad and am still learning how to use it.  I found a case that closes securely and  can stand in portrait or landscape mode which is really nice when viewing Netflix or AppleTV.  If you need a new computer to carry conveniently this Ipad is the way to go unless you really need the power and graphic abilities of the MAC.  My Iphone 14maxpro has 256g of memory and I barely use 100 so I thought I would only need 64g on the Ipad since my phone has the extra capacity.  Not convinced this was a great decision but some of my Iphone content can stay there exclusively  so it might just work out.  Or not…..
title: Nice IPad.  Larger than I thought it would be but easy to carry in a bag
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023

It looks and acts like a brand new iPad. It even came in a iPad box with an OEM charger.  I could easily be convinced that I was sent a brand new one.  I’ve since bought 2 more.  Only one came with a real box, packed like new, but all 3 of them work like new.  There are no dings or scratches and I was able to update them all to the most current iOS version. text: This is my first Apple device. I have always felt their products were overpriced. Now in our economy everything is overpriced. The iPad is the only Apple device that I have even considered purchasing. I have several other brand tablets/laptops but just couldn't pass this up because of the good price. After hearing people praise Apple devices over other brands, there was a lot of hype to live up to. Bottom line, it was a little underwhelming, because of the hype. Taking the device at face value though, this is an excellent device. The pros: the processor and the battery life. I've been using it for over a month. This is the entry level iPad 9th gen but the A13 bionic chip is fast and able to handle multitasking very easily. Granted I only use this device really for entertainment(games, watching videos), browsing the web, checking emails, so I don't use it all day/every day. The battery lasts me a couple of days without charging. Even after watching videos for several hours I still don't have to charge it. The bezels make holding the device easier without blocking the screen. And because of it's 4:3 aspect ratio compared to other tablets 16:10 it makes watching videos/reading a more pleasant experience. I did buy a third party pencil to use with it. It works well for taking notes, there is a audible tap when using the pencil. I don't have any cons-the gestures take some getting used to. I just prefer other brands gestures, they seem more intuitive and useful to me. The screen is nice but it's not noticeably better than any of my other devices. Again this is the entry level iPad so for the price I think this is an excellent device. It should be able to handle most things you throw at it. I recommend this product and I'm glad I bought it.
title: My first and only Apple device and.....I like it!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2023

text: My previous iPad still operates [testimony to Apple’s amazing quality] but it is so old (2012 3rd Gen) it will only run a couple of the apps I enjoy using.  I had stopped using it years ago and grew accustomed to using my iPhone and multiple Mac computers instead.  However, several months back I decided to explore streaming music with a WiiM Pro and felt I needed a larger screen than my iPhone to control the WiiM and read about the music I was listening to via Qobuz.  So I decided to get a new iPad but didn’t need a laptop replacement (i.e., lots of processing power), or cutting edge screen.  And I wanted a “Goldilocks” size.  At around $250 this 9th Gen iPad is a fantastic bargain.It doesn’t have the heft or quality feel of my 3rd Gen, which is made out of steel, but it seems well put together.  The screen is only a tiny, tiny bit better but for what I do the screen is fine.  It’s plenty bright and responsive.  And, of course, it runs every app I choose to use flawlessly.  A few attributes blow me away, however.  Even with what’s now a slightly older processor (A13) it is very fast.  Battery life is staggering.  This iPad is so satisfying, I have switched my usage away from my phone, and even my TV’s to it.  It’s fantastic as a control device for the WiiM, great for recreational web surfing, and I have been using it as a display device for Xfinity Stream to watch local TV.  It’s also perfect for watching YouTube videos.It’s hard to emphasize enough what a screaming bargain this is now - mid 2013.
title: Rekindled My Fondness for Apple iPad
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2023

text: The Apple iPad 9th Generation is a true testament to Apple's unwavering commitment to excellence. With its A13 Bionic chip at the core, this iPad delivers an exceptional performance that sets a new standard for speed and efficiency. Whether I'm multitasking between apps, editing photos, or indulging in graphics-intensive games, the A13 chip handles everything with remarkable ease and fluidity. The seamless experience is further amplified by the 10.2-inch Retina Display, which boasts stunning clarity and vibrant colors, making every image and video come to life. Whether I'm streaming my favorite shows, browsing the web, or immersing myself in creative projects, the display never fails to impress.With 64GB of storage, I never have to worry about running out of space for my apps, files, and memories. The iPad's ability to seamlessly integrate into the Apple ecosystem ensures a seamless experience across all my devices, from my iPhone to my Mac. The Wi-Fi connectivity keeps me effortlessly connected to the digital world, and with the support of Apple Pencil, I can unleash my creativity and take notes with incredible precision.In conclusion, the Apple iPad 9th Generation has exceeded all my expectations, and its outstanding performance, beautiful display, and seamless integration make it a must-have device for both productivity and entertainment. Whether you're a student, professional, or simply an avid tech enthusiast, this iPad is a worthy investment that brings joy and convenience to your daily life. Apple has once again proven why it remains at the forefront of innovation, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase.
title: The Apple iPad 9th Generation - Unleashing the Power of Innovation and Elegance!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2023

text: The iPad9 design is outdated. It doesn't use the latest full-screen and narrow-bezel technology, and still uses round-dot buttons for a relatively modest appearance and low screen-to-body ratio. This is really intolerable, and at a glance you can tell it's not from this era. iPad9's A13 chip is actually okay, but the 3GB of RAM is really too small in today's eyes.But if you're just looking for a tablet to watch videos on, it does do the job perfectly well
title: The screen-to-body ratio is so low that you can tell at a glance that it's an outdated device.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2023

text: This is my fourth iPad since 2011. The old ones still work fine, but eventually run out of memory and get passed down to my grandkids.This time I bit the bullet and bought the maximum amount of storage available. Cost me a couple hundred dollars to replace, but it's still going strong. Like a Timex, it takes a wacking and keeps on working.

title: Not Bad After All
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2023

text: I have had my iPad 9th Generation 64GB Wi-Fi since the end of November, 2022. It has been about 5 months. I upgraded from an iPad Air 2 32GB Wi-Fi (2014 model) that I had for almost 6 years! I have to say that there is a reason why Apple iPads are sold at such a premium price. That's because they provide valuable practical use for far longer than the vast majority of what is available in the tablet market.With that said the 2021 iPad 9th Generation is a base iPad with a limited amount of fancy features and a dated iPad design. Quite frankly, I actually use my iPad on the go and all of the iPads I have had go directly into an Otterbox Defender case. So I hardly notice the little aesthetics in design when my iPads area always in an Otterbox Defender case.I won't make this review long and will highlight the particular reason why I feel the need to write this review at all. I would say there's three top reasons why I believe the iPad 9th generation is excellent: 1. Good CPU performance/64GB base memory capacity, 2. Value pricing, and 3. Apple Pencil/Freeform.1. CPU performance is good with the A13 CPU from the iPhone 11. I am confident that I will be able to use this iPad for at least 4 more years, if not 5. I bought my iPad Air 2 (2014 model) in 2016 and it was supported with OS updates up until iPadOS 15, which is a total of 8 years. But the iPad Air 2 was among the longest supported iPads in Apple's tablet history. So it is not likely to be repeated. But I think that the iPad 9th generation should be supported for at least 6 years, 2021 to 2027. Plus, the 64GB base capacity is excellent for my basic use of the iPad.2. The pricing for the iPad 9th Generation 64GB retails at $329.99, but it is often for sale at $269.99. That's how much I purchased it for during Cyber Monday 2022. It has been on sale for as low as $249.99 at some other retailers as well. So overall, the pricing is very affordable for a device this capable with support for many years to come.3. I know that the Apple Pencil has been out for years, but I have only now tried it. It was not supported with my iPad Air 2 (2014 model) and I never gave it much thought as being useful to me. I always thought that the Apple Pencil was geared towards artists, which to some extent it is. I tried the Apple Pencil on my iPad 9th Generation about a month after getting mine. It was a revolutionary experience for me. I have been looking for a viable substitute for a whiteboard for the longest time. But there is not any real replacement for what you can do on a whiteboard. The Apple Pencil with FreeForm is the closest that I've come to the experience I get on a whiteboard. Although, I do still use a 4'x8' whiteboard for some brainstorming sessions, the Apple Pencil has afforded me to do some basic brainstorming in FreeForm. This is a massive benefit and I can only see Apple getting better with its FreeForm app. Not to mention app developers releasing new apps to take advantage of the Apple Pencil for brainstorming on a virtual whiteboard.Overall, I highly recommend the iPad 9th Generation.
title: Apple does it again, the best of Apple in a great price!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2023

text: Has lots of storage for all my toddlers games. Easy to find and has a very large bulky size but hey she doesn’t carry it far enough to break it. So we leave it where she lays. Could have got the mini but been burned by how easy that was to carry with my first kiddo. Too heavy to hold up that’s the only downfall. So she leans down if holding but everyone does that anyways. We just prop it up and when she’s tired she rolls away from it at night. Because she’s not holding it so close to her face she stays on it a way more appropriate amount of time for a kid.
title: Great product at a great price

We just prop it up and when she’s tired she rolls away from it at night. Because she’s not holding it so close to her face she stays on it a way more appropriate amount of time for a kid.
title: Great product at a great price
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2023

text: The display really doesn't look great by today's standards and the screen-to-body ratio is ridiculously low. And the price isn't cheap, I think this ipad 9TH would be a little better if it either dropped the price some more or came out with an iteration of the typc-c interface model
title: Expected, except that the display isn't too good
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2023

text: This is my fourth iPad since 2011. The old ones still work fine, but eventually run out of memory and get passed down to my grandkids.This time I bit the bullet and bought the maximum amount of storage available. I now have enough memory to download movies for use on long airplane trips.Do yourself a favor, don't cheap out on memory, buy the max and these things will last forever.The only time I had a problem with any of my iPads was when I hit it with a Weed Wacker and destroyed the screen. Cost me a couple hundred dollars to replace, but it's still going strong. Like a Timex, it takes a wacking and keeps on working.
title: LOVE MY iPads
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2023

text: This replaced ipad 5th generation, so the screen is larger & appears to be easier to view. Other than that they are pretty much identical in physical appearance, of course 9th gen has a faster chip along with a few more advanced features, camera/apps, etc. I mostly use it for surfing internet & games & would definitely buy it again. I didn’t like the fact that the stowage went from 64GB to 256GB skipping the normal 128 GB & going to 256 GB was too pricey for my intended use.
title: Excellent iPad
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2023

text: Came in original box in amazing condition! Will be purchasing 3 more for my kids for christmas
title: Like brand new
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023

text: Love the options love the increase battery life charges easily great performance great quality for the price
title: Nice size 10.2
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2023

text: I got this Apple iPad to replace my old one that was starting to have problems. This new one is awesome! It is so fast and the picture is crisp and clear. It charges fast and the battery seems to last a long time. It has plenty of storage too.
title: great Apple product, as always!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2023

text: I am a first time iPad owner. Have been using my iPhone to surf the net, send email and messages, etc. Found this iPad 9th Gen at a great bargain on Amazon Prime day. Couldn’t be more happy with the purchase. It does everything I want it to and its larger screen is so much easier to view than my iPhone. Only downside is the smaller 64 GB storage. Could have upgraded, but the price would have been considerably higher. Very happy with the purchase, and would definitely recommend.
title: Really love my new iPad!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2023

text: Being a Windows/Android user, the iPad takes some getting used to.After some internet searches, I was able to familiarize myself with its nuances.I use it mostly for annotating PDFs for research work. The screen and its color are outstanding.Would I buy it again? Not sure yet.
title: Not Bad After All
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2023

text: I have had my iPad 9th Generation 64GB Wi-Fi since the end of November, 2022. It has been about 5 months. I upgraded from an iPad Air 2 32GB Wi-Fi (2014 model) that I had for almost 6 years! I have to say that there is a reason why Apple iPads are sold at such a premium price. That's because they provide valuable practical use for far longer than the vast majority of what is available in the tablet market.With that said the 2021 iPad 9th Generation is a base iPad with a limited amount of fancy features and a dated iPad design. Quite frankly, I actually use my iPad on the go and all of the iPads I have had go directly into an Otterbox Defender case. So I hardly notice the little aesthetics in design when my iPads area always in an Otterbox Defender case.I won't make this review long and will highlight the particular reason why I feel the need to write this review at all. I would say there's three top reasons why I believe the iPad 9th generation is excellent: 1. Good CPU performance/64GB base memory capacity, 2. Value pricing, and 3. Apple Pencil/Freeform.1. CPU performance is good with the A13 CPU from the iPhone 11. I am confident that I will be able to use this iPad for at least 4 more years, if not 5. I bought my iPad Air 2 (2014 model) in 2016 and it was supported with OS updates up until iPadOS 15, which is a total of 8 years. But the iPad Air 2 was among the longest supported iPads in Apple's tablet history. So it is not likely to be repeated. But I think that the iPad 9th generation should be supported for at least 6 years, 2021 to 2027. Plus, the 64GB base capacity is excellent for my basic use of the iPad.2. The pricing for the iPad 9th Generation 64GB retails at $329.99, but it is often for sale at $269.99. That's how much I purchased it for during Cyber Monday 2022. It has been on sale for as low as $249.99 at some other retailers as well. So overall, the pricing is very affordable for a device this capable with support for many years to come.3. I know that the Apple Pencil has been out for years, but I have only now tried it. It was not supported with my iPad Air 2 (2014 model) and I never gave it much thought as being useful to me. I always thought that the Apple Pencil was geared towards artists, which to some extent it is. I tried the Apple Pencil on my iPad 9th Generation about a month after getting mine. It was a revolutionary experience for me. I have been looking for a viable substitute for a whiteboard for the longest time. But there is not any real replacement for what you can do on a whiteboard. The Apple Pencil with FreeForm is the closest that I've come to the experience I get on a whiteboard. Although, I do still use a 4'x8' whiteboard for some brainstorming sessions, the Apple Pencil has afforded me to do some basic brainstorming in FreeForm. This is a massive benefit and I can only see Apple getting better with its FreeForm app. Not to mention app developers releasing new apps to take advantage of the Apple Pencil for brainstorming on a virtual whiteboard.Overall, I highly recommend the iPad 9th Generation.
title: Apple does it again, the best of Apple in a great price!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2023
